They have this annoying thing where they keep reminding you to take the yogurt off the scale - please put up a sign or something - I think it would save the staff from having to repeat the same thing to every customer.
author: Nin J.

description: Stopped by today after lunch today and had a bowl of Signature Tart and Mango Tart. It's much more sour that how I usually like my yogurt. I was a bit confused at first by how the pricing works - basically they weigh the bowl (at 45 cents per ounce). My bowl today sets me back $3.50, not too shabby being a little picker-upper for Monday.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Alright. I'll admit it.  A decent portion of my paycheck is allocated for frozen yogurt.  I'd like to think I'm an afficionado rather than an addict, and Yoppi is definitely at the top of my list.  They have 8 different flavors(5 of which rotate out on a weekly basis) and a wide variety of toppings, so there's something for everyone.  Yoppi is best known for their yellow cake batter fro yo, so if it's your first time here, you MUST try it!
author: Vanessa K.

description: God damn, the yellow cake batter and cheesecake are to die for.  I like that they charge by-the-weight, so if you need just a little something sweet in the afternoon, you dont have to pay a lot.
author: brewgirl b.

description: I'm only going to rate one flavor because that was the best flavor that I chose for today, which is their classic chocolate.  I am a fiend on sourness so most of the condiments were out of the question because I wanted something really sour.   I just grabbed some strawberry and kiwi.  Personally, I think this flavor can stand out on its own without the condiments . It's 45 cent per ounce.  I am curious about the ingredients in the yogurt.
author: pengrin ..

description: Yummy Yoppi yogurt!!!  I love the self-serve aspect; let's me try a little of everything.  Loved the topping of the mango-flavored caviar thingies.  So good with the mango and regular tart yogurt.  Definitely worth checking out!
author: Lisa M.

description: This review makes me sad but it must be done. I was a regular at Yogi, often going 2-3x/week.  Unfortunately the increasing rudeness of the main store staffer has curtailed my visits.  Perhaps the manager, you'll recognize her immediately she the one who looks full time miserable and always there.   She hates Yoppi, her life, and most of all you.  Consistently nasty and rude she behavior hit a new low last week when at 5:55pm she came up behind me and mumbled "We're closing, get out ". I thought I must have misheard her, but then she repeated the same message hateful tone and all to the other group of customers.  How can someone surrounded by yummy candy treats be so unhappy?
author: lisa g.

description: Holy cow, I just had the most delicious banana frozen yogurt, topped with Reese's Peanut Butter Cup crumbles!  Every flavor I sampled was great, and really tasted like what it was - such as the Red Velvet Cake and the Yellow Cake Mix.  This was my first visit to Yoppi, and I will definitely be going back.  The price is good and the yogurt is only 100 calories per 4 oz serving.  And they change the flavors up every week!
author: Lisa T.

description: I am a fro-yo fan and I love this place! They charge by weight, I think something like 45 cents per ounce. They have great flavors that you can vote on weekly and I always find something new and delicious. Oh and they also have a great assortment of toppings! Today I had white chocolate raspberry and chocolate fro-yo with nuts and chocolate chips. Definitely a great escape from my computer!
author: Cherie S.

description: Had the yellow cake batter on their first day open.  A fairly generous helping for under $3. Working so close to it could be dangerous.
author: L. Renee D.

description: I love Yoppi!  I go there nearly every single day, since they are in my building.  It is my guilt-free pleasure.  The cake batter flavor is wonderful, especially if you add a dolop of French vanilla, chocolate and sprinkle it with cake sprinkles.  Unlike what someone else said, I like the little orange ball toppings.  They are called "fruit caviar" and give a little burst of fruit flavor when you chew them.  I wish they didn't have Red Velvet at the same time as they have chocolate because the flavors are identical and they'd have room for another flavor if they omitted it, but that's a small thing compared to the yumminess of the experience.
author: Jo Anne C.

description: This place is good.  I tried their signature tart which was amazing.  I also loved the yellow cake batter, that's right -- yellow cake batter frozen yogurt!!  It hit the spot for my sweet tooth and I'll definitely go back.  I wish they'd drop the 45 cent an ounce price and help out my recession wallet.
author: Cabo G.
